comment:
Optimization Problem:This problem involves maximizing or minimizing a certain objective function (in this case, total earnings) subject to constraints (such as the number of vehicles, pollution limits, and passenger requirements).
Constraint:A restriction that limits the possible solutions to the optimization problem. In this case, constraints include the maximum percentage of motorcycles, pollution limits, and passenger requirements.
Objective Function:The function that needs to be optimized (maximized or minimized) in an optimization problem. In this case, the objective function is the total earnings of the taxi company per shift.
